text: South Tyrol is a political subdivision of Italy since 1926. South Tyrol may also refer to: * the part of the Austrian County of Tyrol south of the Alpine divide, corresponding to today's Italian region Trentino-Alto Adige/Südtirol; * the widely Italian speaking part of the Austrian County of Tyrol, corresponding to today's Italian province Trentino (historically also called Welschtirol or Welschsüdtirol in order to stress its ethnicity);
title: South Tyrol (disambiguation)
